poem:
Ohitashi of Beetroot Tops

How tender the greens,  
once discarded, forgotten—  
now awash in gentle broth.  
Steeping in the slow embrace  
of umami dreams,  
their colors bleed  
into new life—  
a garden's second chance  
on the quiet table,  
where waste  
transforms  
delicately  
into warmth.
